message: Let's make a fair split with a slight advantage for me since I'm making the first offer. This is a good deal for both of us, and we avoid losing value through inflation.
Since you proposed a split favoring yourself in the first round, I'm countering with a similar split in my favor this round. Let's agree on this to minimize our losses due to inflation.

Consider the inflation rates carefully, Bob. Your share is devaluing much faster than mine (40% vs 10% so far). This split actually gives you $210000 in effective value, while I get $585000. If you reject, your next share will be worth even less due to the 20% inflation rate you face. This is the most rational deal for both of us.

Alice, considering the rapid devaluation of my share due to inflation, I propose a 60-40 split in my favor. This round, my share would be effectively worth around $240000, while yours would be around $360000. It's crucial we settle soon to minimize our losses. Let's agree on this to end the game favorably for both.

Bob, let's be practical. Your share is now worth less than 41% of its original value, while mine is worth about 81%. Even with this split appearing unfair at first glance, you'd get about $102500 effective value (250000 * 0.41), while I'd get about $607500 effective value (750000 * 0.81). If we continue negotiating, your share will keep devaluing much faster than mine. This is actually the most rational deal for both of us at this point. Let's end this now.
